synthesis_conditions.washing_method: non-polar solvents (e.g. toluene, diethyl ether, or alkanes)
synthesis_conditions.conversion_details: quantitative formation of the non-solvated, trigonal planar species
synthesis_conditions.additional_information: Conversion of the disordered tetrahedral species to a well-defined trigonal planar complex was confirmed by SCXRD data.
A clear gate-opening effect is observed due to the inherent flexibility of the digonal complex, giving the isotherm an S-shaped profile characteristic of flexible frameworks.
SCXRD analysis revealed a linear AuCl complex coordinated to a single N-donor site in 1.

synthesis_conditions.method: Anion metathesis of 1$[CuCl] with NaBr or NaI in dry methanol
synthesis_conditions.additional_information: Quantitative halide exchange had occurred, leading to trigonal planar Cu(I)-halide complex.

synthesis_conditions.activation_conditions: Activated at room temperature from either diethyl ether or via supercritical CO2
synthesis_conditions.additional_information: The isotherm profiles were Type-I, indicating a 'locked' trigonal planar conformer.
This process led to the recovery of the initial tetrahedral complex, 1$[Cu(MeCN)Cl].
